-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output "Error: $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable "icinga-powershell-*" )`r`nModule-Path:`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath)"; exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckUNCPath'

7.description:
A warning threshold for the shares total free space in byte units, like "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
7.caption: WarningTotal

9.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin. Default to FALSE.
9.caption: NoPerfData

10.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
10.caption: Verbosity

3.description: The path to a volume or network share you want to monitor, like "\\example.com\Home" or "C:\ClusterSharedVolume\Volume1"
3.caption: Path

2.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
2.caption: ThresholdInterval

4.description:
Modifies the plugin output to not display the value provided within the `-Path` argument but to use this string value
instead of shorten the output and make it more visual appealing.
4.caption: DisplayAlias

6.description:
A critical threshold for the shares free space in either % or byte units, like "20%:" or "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: %, B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
6.caption: Critical

5.description:
A warning threshold for the shares free space in either % or byte units, like "20%:" or "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: %, B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
5.caption: Warning

8.description:
A warning threshold for the shares total free space in byte units, like "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
8.caption: CriticalTotal
